case_title: COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX vs MARGADARSI CHIT FUND (P.) LTD.

legal_issues.issue: Whether the Tribunal was correct in allowing deduction under Section 32 of the Income-tax Act for bottles leased out as a business.

key_arguments.argument: Depreciation under Section 32(1) is allowable only for bulk purchases and not for single items priced below Rs. 5,000.
Bottles used in the business qualify as 'plant' under Section 32(1) and are eligible for depreciation.

key_precedents.case_name: CIT v. Sri Krishna Bottlers (Pvt.) Ltd.
key_precedents.holding: Bottles used in business are considered 'plant' and eligible for 100% depreciation.

statutes_referenced.description: Allows depreciation on buildings, machinery, plant, or furniture used for business or profession.
Allows full deduction for machinery or plant costing less than Rs. 5,000 in the year it is first used.

court_observations: Bottles leased out as part of the respondent's business qualify as 'plant' under Section 32(1).
No distinction exists between bulk purchases and individual purchases for depreciation purposes.
Depreciation can be claimed if the item is integrally involved in the business.
final_decision: The Tribunal's decision was upheld, and the petition was dismissed.
